poem:
Title: In The Arms of The Unseen

Charities cast their nets of care,
In the cool shadow of the state,
Unpaid, often untold, they dare
To stand where governance may vacate.

But should our trust in unseen hands,
Mute and faceless, ever grow?
Or in the state, drawn in the sands,
Whose contours we already know?

Civil society's subtle dance,
In freedom's name, cannot romance.
